item.title: 法国将预算谈判推迟至 2026 年，引发赤字疑虑
item.description: 法国议会的一个委员会未能就 2026 年的预算案达成一致意见，这将有关全面财政计划的讨论推向了新的一年，也增加了人们对政府如何控制赤字的疑虑。【原文：A French parliamentary committee failed to agree on a 2026 budget, pushing discussion on the full fiscal plan into the new year and increasing doubts over how the government can rein in the deficit.】

item.title: 美国国债迎来 11 月以来首次周度上涨
item.description: 基准美国国债有望实现 11 月以来的首次单周上涨，此前意外降温的通胀数据和失业率的飙升巩固了美联储明年将至少降息两次的预期。【原文：Benchmark US Treasuries are on track for their first weekly gain since November after unexpectedly cool inflation numbers and a jump in the jobless rate cemented expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut rates at least twice next year.】

item.title: 俄罗斯在明年增税前选择适度下调关键利率
item.description: 俄罗斯连续第二次将基准利率下调了半个百分点，此举对企业几乎没有什么帮助，但却凸显了人们对即将到来的增税可能会刺激通货膨胀的担忧。【原文：Russia lowered its benchmark interest rate by half a percentage point for the second consecutive time, a move that will offer little relief to businesses but underscores concerns that an upcoming tax hike could stoke inflation.】

item.title: 在高盛和 Citadel 证券公司，圣诞老人反弹有了信仰者
item.description: 在 12 月份的大部分时间里，交易员们都在猜测典型的年末 "圣诞老人反弹 "是否会启动，现在他们可能终于等到了自己一直在等待的东西。【原文：Traders who spent most of December wondering if the typical year-end “Santa Claus rally” was ever going to kick in may finally be getting what they’ve been waiting for.】

item.title: 六张图表展示 2025 年股市如何重塑
item.description: 股票投资者不能说今年的市场缺乏戏剧性。【原文：Stock investors can’t claim that this year has lacked market drama.】

item.title: 德国联邦银行称 2026 年德国国内生产总值将 "显著增强
item.description: 德国联邦银行（Bundesbank）表示，在国防和基础设施公共支出增加的帮助下，德国经济将在明年逐步复苏，并在 2027 年获得增长势头。【原文：Germany’s economy will gradually recover next year and gain momentum in 2027, helped by higher public outlays on defense and infrastructure, the Bundesbank said.】

item.title: 泡沫和无聊的赌注：2026 年科技股将何去何从？
item.description: 在投资者的记忆中，2025 年是人工智能涨势扩大的一年，人们对人工智能的担忧也变得更加明显。【原文：Investors will remember 2025 as the year the artificial intelligence rally broadened out and the fears became more pronounced — not only of a bubble in the stocks, but also of the disruption the technology represents.】

item.title: Wafra 首席执行官 Al-Mubaraki 将离开科威特所有的私人资产公司
item.description: Wafra Inc. 首席执行官法瓦兹-穆巴拉基（Fawaz Al-Mubaraki）在领导这家科威特国家养老金机构旗下的投资管理公司近十年后，将于年底离职。【原文：Fawaz Al-Mubaraki, the chief executive officer of Wafra Inc., is leaving at year-end after almost a decade leading the investment manager owned by Kuwait’s state pension agency.】

item.title: 欧洲央行加紧审查 SRT 热潮，快速处理部分交易
item.description: 欧洲中央银行表示，在加快审批部分交易的同时，将加强对重大风险转移的监控。【原文：The European Central Bank said it will intensify how it monitors significant risk transfers as it speeds up approvals for some of the deals.】

item.title: 据说桥点公司将通过纽伯里交易拓展二级市场
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，英国收购公司桥点集团（Bridgepoint Group Plc）将从中型二级市场公司纽伯里合伙公司（Newbury Partners）抽调一个团队，进军私募股权市场快速增长的领域。【原文：UK buyout firm Bridgepoint Group Plc is expanding into a fast-growing segment of the private equity market by adding a team from mid-market secondaries firm Newbury Partners, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 随着 Vibe Coding 的腾飞，Lovable 获得 66 亿美元估值
item.description: 随着对有助于软件开发的人工智能工具的需求激增，Lovable 公司以 66 亿美元的估值筹集了 3.3 亿美元的新资金。【原文：Lovable has raised $330 million in fresh funding at a $6.6 billion valuation, as demand for artificial intelligence tools that can help software development surges.】

item.title: 印度消费科技公司首次公开募股后反弹，卖空者受到冲击
item.description: 押注印度新上市的消费技术初创企业的卖空者正在被烧毁，因为上市后的大幅反弹迫使他们高价平仓看跌押注。【原文：Short sellers betting against India’s newly listed consumer-tech startups are getting burned as sharp rallies after listing force them to close their bearish bets at high prices.】

item.title: 以建筑商为首的芬兰破产数量创 1997 年以来新高
item.description: 芬兰的破产率达到了近三十年来的最高水平，其中建筑公司的破产率居高不下。【原文：Bankruptcies in Finland reached the highest level in almost three decades, with construction companies driving the insolvencies.】

item.title: 英格兰银行贝利警告：人工智能可能取代工人的工作
item.description: 英国央行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）在对人工智能技术的影响发出最严厉的警告时说，人工智能很可能会取代英国工人的工作，即使它能提高英国的生产力。【原文：Artificial intelligence is likely to displace British workers even as it makes the country more productive, Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said in his most stark warning yet on the technology’s impact.】

item.title: The Booming Business of Chinese Peptides
item.description: Everyone seems to be experimenting.

item.title: 芬兰银行雷恩呼吁采取行动解决芬兰赤字问题
item.description: 芬兰央行行长奥利-雷恩（Olli Rehn）呼吁北欧国家政府决定采取更多措施来修复其濒临崩溃的公共财政。【原文：Bank of Finland Governor Olli Rehn called on the Nordic country’s government to decide on more measures to fix its ailing public finances.】

item.title: India’s Health-Tech Firm Practo Said to Seek Banks for 2026 IPO
item.description: Practo Technologies Pvt., which runs a digital health platform, is planning an initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter, joining a wave of companies rushing to capitalize on India’s buoyant market for first-time share sales.

item.title: ECB Officials Wary on Direction of Next Interest-Rate Move
item.description: European Central Bank policymakers are circumspect on where borrowing costs may go next, comfortable to stay on hold for the time being as they survey inflation risks.

item.title: Euro-Zone Wage Growth to Pick Up in Second Half of Next Year
item.description: Pay growth in the euro area is set to accelerate in the latter half of next year, supporting the European Central Bank’s assessment that there’s currently no need to lower interest rates further.

item.title: France Is in Danger if 2026 Deficit Not Contained, Villeroy Says
item.description: France could face a market backlash if plans to repair the public finances fail to bring its deficit within 5% of economic output next year, the country’s central bank chief said.

item.title: 日本电产董事长在接连出现会计问题后退出董事会
item.description: 日本电产公司（Nidec Corp.）表示，在发现多年前的一系列会计问题后，公司创始人永守重信（Shigenobu Nagamori）将辞去董事长一职。【原文：Nidec Corp. said its founder Shigenobu Nagamori will step down from his position as chairman of the board, following the discovery of a series of accounting issues dating back years.】

item.title: Alecta Cleared by Swedish FSA After Probe on Failed US Banks
item.description: Alecta AB has been cleared of wrongdoing over its losses tied to three failed US regional banks, after Sweden’s Financial Supervisory Authority found no breaches in how the pension fund measured or valued risks in its listed-equities portfolio.

item.title: South Korea Acts to Stabilize Forex Market as Won Weakens
item.description: The Bank of Korea and the government took more measures to ease pressure on the won after an unscheduled board meeting, intensifying support for Asia’s worst-performing currency.

item.title: Coty Sells Remaining 25.8% Stake in Haircare Brand Wella to KKR
item.description: Coty Inc. has sold its remaining stake in Wella to KKR & Co. for $750 million in cash and rights to certain future proceeds.

item.title: WH Smith Faces FCA Probe Over Accounting Error That Hit Shares
item.description: WH Smith Plc is under investigation by the UK’s Financial Conduct Authority over the accounting error in its North American business that triggered a stock slump and the resignation of its chief executive officer.

item.title: Peace Hopes Add to Valuation Question for Europe’s Defense Rally
item.description: A sharp fourth-quarter pullback in Europe’s defense stocks has shone a spotlight on the shifting narrative for what’s been a key driver of the region’s equities rally this year.

item.title: BOJ’s Hike Seen as Net Plus of $5 Billion for Japan Households
item.description: The Bank of Japan’s interest-rate hike to a three-decade high of 0.75% is likely a net positive for households — to the tune of about ¥800 billion ($5 billion) a year, according to Mizuho Research & Technologies Ltd.’s senior economist.

item.title: GLP Is Said to Pick Investment Banks for 2026 Hong Kong IPO
item.description: Investment firm GLP Pte has selected banks for a Hong Kong initial public offering that may take place as soon as the first half of 2026, according to people familiar with the situation.

item.title: UK Deficit Falls in First Public Finances Data Since Budget
item.description: UK government borrowing fell in November as the economy continued to generate healthy tax receipts and debt costs declined, a modest boost for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves weeks after she unveiled a difficult budget.
